name: Soul Mirrors Tarot
description: A 22-card Major Arcana deck for deep self-reflection and inner exploration. Each card is a mirror reflecting aspects of your soul's journey.

cards.name: The Dreamer
cards.summary: The soul before it awakens to its journey, full of potential and wonder.
cards.interpretation: The Dreamer represents the part of you that remains eternally innocent, the aspect of your soul that can still be amazed by the world. This card invites you to approach your current situation with beginner's mind, releasing expectations and allowing yourself to not-know. What if the answer isn't in your accumulated wisdom, but in your capacity for wonder?
cards.reversed_interpretation: When reversed, The Dreamer may indicate fear of the unknown holding you back, or perhaps reckless naivety. Are you avoiding a necessary leap, or rushing forward without grounding? Consider what would help you trust the journey while staying connected to reality.
cards.affirmation: I trust my soul's journey into the unknown.
questions: What am I afraid to begin?
Where could beginner's mind serve me?
What would I do if I couldn't fail?

cards.name: The Alchemist
cards.summary: The creative force that transforms intention into reality.
cards.interpretation: The Alchemist reminds you that you have all the tools you need. Your thoughts, emotions, actions, and spirit are the elements you work with to create your reality. This card asks: what are you currently creating with the resources available to you? Are you consciously choosing your ingredients, or mixing unconsciously?
cards.reversed_interpretation: Reversed, The Alchemist may indicate scattered energy, manipulation, or using your gifts in ways misaligned with your true will. Are you creating from ego or soul? What would happen if you paused to clarify your intention?
cards.affirmation: I consciously create my reality with wisdom and intention.
questions: What am I creating right now?
Are my tools in alignment with my highest purpose?
Where is my creative energy scattered?

cards.name: The Veil
cards.summary: The wisdom that lives beyond words, in the spaces between thoughts.
cards.interpretation: The Veil invites you to trust what you cannot explain. Behind the rational mind lies a vast ocean of knowing that speaks through dreams, symbols, body sensations, and synchronicities. This card suggests that the answer you seek may not come through logical analysis, but through quiet receptivity. What is your intuition whispering?
cards.reversed_interpretation: Reversed, The Veil may indicate blocked intuition, secrets being kept (by you or from you), or disconnection from inner wisdom. Are you ignoring the subtle messages? Is the veil protecting something that needs light?
cards.affirmation: I honor the wisdom that speaks in silence.
questions: What does my intuition already know?
What am I not ready to see?
How can I create more space for inner listening?

cards.name: The Garden
cards.summary: The fertile soil where all life flourishes through love and care.
cards.interpretation: The Garden represents your capacity to nurture - yourself, others, and your creative projects. Everything grows in this space of unconditional love and patient tending. This card asks: what in your life needs more nurturing? What is ready to bloom if given attention?
cards.reversed_interpretation: Reversed, The Garden may indicate neglect, over-giving to the point of depletion, or creative blocks. Are you watering everyone else's garden while yours goes dry? Is perfectionism preventing natural growth?
cards.affirmation: I nurture myself and others with abundant love.
questions: What needs my loving attention?
Where am I neglecting my own garden?
What is ready to bloom?

cards.name: The Builder
cards.summary: The part of you that creates order, sets limits, and builds lasting foundations.
cards.interpretation: The Builder calls you to examine the structures in your life - both internal and external. What beliefs, habits, and systems are you operating within? This card often appears when it's time to either strengthen existing foundations or question whether they still serve you. What are you building, and is the foundation solid?
cards.reversed_interpretation: Reversed, The Builder may indicate rigidity, excessive control, or crumbling structures. Are you holding on too tightly to how things 'should' be? Is a structure in your life ready to be dismantled?
cards.affirmation: I build structures that support my soul's freedom.
questions: What structures no longer serve me?
Where do I need better boundaries?
Am I building what I truly want?

cards.name: The Bridge
cards.summary: The wisdom passed down through generations, connecting us to something greater.
cards.interpretation: The Bridge represents the teachings, traditions, and meaning-making systems that connect you to community and lineage. This card invites you to explore: what wisdom have you received from those who came before? What do you pass on? Are the bridges you walk on still sound, or do they need repair or replacement?
cards.reversed_interpretation: Reversed, The Bridge may indicate dogma, rejected wisdom, or disconnection from meaningful tradition. Are you rebelling just to rebel? Or are you blindly following without questioning?
cards.affirmation: I honor the wisdom of those who walked before me while finding my own path.
questions: What teachings have shaped me?
What wisdom am I called to share?
Where do I need to question tradition?

cards.name: The Dance
cards.summary: The movement between self and other, choosing what and whom we embrace.
cards.interpretation: The Dance is about relationships of all kinds - with others, with parts of yourself, with values and commitments. This card appears when you're making choices about what to unite with and what to release. Who and what are you choosing to dance with? Are you moving in harmony or stepping on toes?
cards.reversed_interpretation: Reversed, The Dance may indicate imbalance in relationship, avoidance of necessary choices, or inner conflict between parts of yourself. What choice are you avoiding? What parts of yourself are not in communication?
cards.affirmation: I choose my partners in life's dance with awareness and love.
questions: What relationships need attention?
What choice am I avoiding?
How can I integrate opposing parts of myself?

cards.name: The Journey
cards.summary: The soul moving forward with purpose, mastering opposing forces.
cards.interpretation: The Journey represents forward motion through sheer will and determination. You are the driver of your life, and this card asks about your direction. Are you moving toward what you truly want? Are the different parts of yourself (your light and shadow) working together or pulling you apart?
cards.reversed_interpretation: Reversed, The Journey may indicate scattered direction, aggression without purpose, or the ego running the show. Are you chasing external victory while losing your soul? Is it time to slow down and recalibrate?
cards.affirmation: I move forward with aligned will and clear purpose.
questions: Where am I headed?
Is my ego or soul driving?
What conflicting forces need to be harmonized?

cards.name: The Heart
cards.summary: The strength that comes from the heart, taming the wild with gentleness.
cards.interpretation: The Heart reminds you that true strength is not domination but loving presence. This card appears when you're learning to work with - not against - the wild, instinctual parts of yourself. What in you needs to be met with compassion rather than force? How can you be fierce and tender at once?
cards.reversed_interpretation: Reversed, The Heart may indicate repressed anger, self-doubt, or using force where gentleness is needed. Are you afraid of your own power? Or are you being too harsh with yourself?
cards.affirmation: My gentleness is my greatest strength.
questions: What wild part of me needs compassion?
Where am I using force when love would work better?
How can I be both fierce and tender?

cards.name: The Lantern
cards.summary: The inner light that guides us through periods of solitude and seeking.
cards.interpretation: The Lantern invites you into a period of solitary reflection. Sometimes the answers we seek can only be found within, and this requires stepping back from the noise of the world. What light do you carry inside that can illuminate your path? What wisdom emerges when you're truly alone with yourself?
cards.reversed_interpretation: Reversed, The Lantern may indicate isolation becoming harmful, or wisdom not being applied. Are you hiding rather than retreating purposefully? Is it time to return from the mountain?
cards.affirmation: I carry my own light into the darkness.
questions: What solitude am I being called to?
What wisdom have I not yet applied?
What is my inner light showing me?

cards.name: The Wheel
cards.summary: The eternal dance of change, reminding us that nothing stays the same.
cards.interpretation: The Wheel reminds you that you are part of larger cycles - personal, collective, cosmic. What goes up comes down; what goes down comes up. This card appears at turning points, inviting you to notice where you are in the cycle. Are you rising, falling, or at the pivot point? How can you work with rather than against the turning?
cards.reversed_interpretation: Reversed, The Wheel may indicate resistance to change, feeling stuck, or bad luck that's actually a redirection. Are you trying to stop the wheel? What if this 'setback' is the turn you needed?
cards.affirmation: I surrender to the wisdom of life's cycles.
questions: Where am I in the cycle?
What am I resisting?
How is change serving my growth?

cards.name: The Mirror
cards.summary: The unflinching reflection that shows us exactly where we stand.
cards.interpretation: The Mirror asks you to see clearly, without the distortions of wishful thinking or denial. What is the truth of your current situation? This card is not about punishment but clarity - when you can see what is, you can work with it. What reflection are you avoiding? What balance needs to be restored?
cards.reversed_interpretation: Reversed, The Mirror may indicate injustice, denial, or dishonesty - with yourself or others. Where are you not being fair? What truth are you refusing to see?
cards.affirmation: I see myself and my situation clearly, with compassion and honesty.
questions: What truth am I avoiding?
Where is balance needed?
What would honest self-reflection reveal?

cards.name: The Pause
cards.summary: The sacred stillness that allows us to see everything differently.
cards.interpretation: The Pause invites you to stop trying, stop pushing, stop doing - and simply be. Sometimes the greatest wisdom comes from hanging suspended, seeing the world from an unfamiliar angle. What would happen if you stopped struggling and simply surrendered to what is? What sacrifice of ego or agenda is being asked of you?
cards.reversed_interpretation: Reversed, The Pause may indicate stalling, martyrdom, or resistance to a necessary surrender. Are you pausing productively or just stuck? Is your sacrifice serving anyone?
cards.affirmation: I surrender to the wisdom of not-doing.
questions: What would happen if I stopped trying so hard?
What perspective shift is available if I pause?
What am I being asked to sacrifice?

cards.name: The Release
cards.summary: The necessary endings that make space for new life.
cards.interpretation: The Release is not about literal death but about the deaths we experience throughout life - of identities, relationships, beliefs, phases. Something is ending, and this card invites you to let it go with grace. What needs to die so that something new can be born? What are you holding onto that is already gone?
cards.reversed_interpretation: Reversed, The Release may indicate resistance to necessary endings, stagnation, or fear of change so strong it creates suffering. What are you refusing to let die? What resurrection is being blocked?
cards.affirmation: I release what has ended so new life can begin.
questions: What is ready to die in my life?
What am I holding onto that is already gone?
What new life is waiting to be born?

cards.name: The Flow
cards.summary: The art of blending opposites into something greater than either.
cards.interpretation: The Flow represents the middle path, the integration of extremes, the patient work of combining different elements into harmony. This card appears when balance is needed - not the static balance of standing still, but the dynamic balance of constant adjustment. What needs to be blended in your life? Where does patience serve you?
cards.reversed_interpretation: Reversed, The Flow may indicate imbalance, impatience, or excess. Are you veering to extremes? Is your impatience disrupting the alchemy?
cards.affirmation: I blend all parts of myself into harmonious flow.
questions: Where do I need more balance?
What extremes need to be integrated?
How can patience serve me here?

cards.name: The Shadow
cards.summary: The parts of ourselves we've exiled that still run the show.
cards.interpretation: The Shadow asks you to look at what you've hidden from yourself - your disowned desires, fears, and aspects. These don't disappear when denied; they go underground and influence from the shadows. This card invites you to bring compassionate awareness to your shadow. What chains you that you pretend don't exist? What power lies in what you've rejected?
cards.reversed_interpretation: Reversed, The Shadow may indicate breaking free from bondage, or denial so deep you can't even see your chains. Are you waking up to your patterns, or still completely unconscious of them?
cards.affirmation: I embrace my shadow as a source of hidden wisdom and power.
questions: What have I disowned in myself?
What chains am I pretending don't exist?
What power lies in my shadow?

cards.name: The Storm
cards.summary: The lightning strike that destroys false structures to reveal truth.
cards.interpretation: The Storm represents sudden, dramatic change that shatters what was built on false foundations. This is not punishment but liberation - even if it doesn't feel like it in the moment. What structures in your life are ready to be struck by lightning? What revelation is trying to break through? The storm clears the air for clearer seeing.
cards.reversed_interpretation: Reversed, The Storm may indicate fear of necessary change, prolonged crisis, or avoiding the inevitable breakdown. Are you trying to reinforce a building that needs to fall? What would happen if you let the storm come?
cards.affirmation: I welcome the storms that set me free from false structures.
questions: What false structure is ready to fall?
What truth is trying to break through?
How can I surrender to necessary destruction?

cards.name: The Spring
cards.summary: The eternal source that replenishes the soul after the storm.
cards.interpretation: The Spring appears after crisis, bringing healing waters and renewed hope. This card reminds you that no matter how dark the night, dawn comes. There is a source of renewal available to you - perhaps in nature, creativity, connection, or spirit. Where is your spring? Are you allowing yourself to be replenished?
cards.reversed_interpretation: Reversed, The Spring may indicate blocked hope, neglected self-care, or disconnection from inspiration. What is blocking your access to the healing waters? Are you refusing rest?
cards.affirmation: I drink from the eternal spring of hope and healing.
questions: What replenishes my soul?
Am I allowing myself to heal?
Where is hope trying to emerge?

cards.name: The Deep
cards.summary: The mysterious depths where fears and gifts swim together.
cards.interpretation: The Deep invites you into the unconscious waters where things are not as they seem. This is the realm of dreams, fears, intuition, and imagination. The path through The Deep requires trusting your inner compass when you cannot see clearly. What fears are projecting onto your path? What gifts lie in the depths you're afraid to explore?
cards.reversed_interpretation: Reversed, The Deep may indicate emerging clarity, or deception becoming conscious. Are the illusions lifting? Or are you about to go even deeper into confusion?
cards.affirmation: I navigate the mysterious depths with my inner knowing as my guide.
questions: What fears are distorting my perception?
What lies in the depths I haven't explored?
How can I trust my inner compass in the dark?

cards.name: The Radiance
cards.summary: The brilliant light of conscious awareness illuminating everything.
cards.interpretation: The Radiance brings warmth, clarity, and the simple joy of being alive. After the journey through darkness, here is light - not the artificial light of denial, but the authentic radiance of someone who has integrated their shadows. This card celebrates aliveness. Where is joy available to you? What would it mean to shine without apology?
cards.reversed_interpretation: Reversed, The Radiance may indicate dimmed joy, burnout, or false positivity covering real pain. Is your light truly shining, or are you performing happiness? What is blocking your authentic radiance?
cards.affirmation: I shine with the joy of being fully alive.
questions: Where is authentic joy available to me?
What dims my natural radiance?
How can I let myself shine?

cards.name: The Awakening
cards.summary: The cosmic call to rise up and fulfill your soul's purpose.
cards.interpretation: The Awakening represents the moment of hearing your calling clearly - the voice that summons you to become who you truly are. This is not judgment from outside but your own soul calling you to account. Have you been living in alignment with your deepest truth? What is your soul calling you to become? The Awakening says: rise.
cards.reversed_interpretation: Reversed, The Awakening may indicate a call you're ignoring, self-doubt blocking your rising, or fear of judgment. What calling are you refusing to hear? What would it take to respond?
cards.affirmation: I hear my soul's calling and I rise to answer it.
questions: What is my soul calling me to become?
What part of me is ready to rise?
How am I being asked to awaken?

cards.name: The Completion
cards.summary: The dance of completed integration, holding all parts in dynamic harmony.
cards.interpretation: The Completion represents the fulfillment of the soul's journey - not an ending but a moment of wholeness before the next cycle begins. All the lessons have been integrated; all the parts dance together. This card celebrates arrival and completion while knowing the journey continues. What cycle is completing in your life? What wholeness is available right now?
cards.reversed_interpretation: Reversed, The Completion may indicate unfinished business, fear of completion, or resisting the end of a cycle. What do you need to complete before you can move on? What are you afraid will end?
cards.affirmation: I celebrate the wholeness of my journey, complete in this moment.
questions: What cycle is completing?
What have I integrated through this journey?
How am I whole right now?
